messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] from unschool grad -shyness
messages.msgSnippet: ... He just turned 11. I, too, spent a lot of time being with him at events. I remember the first time he went off by himself for over an hour.  It was with a
messages.messageBody:
At 10:37 PM 4/16/2000 EDT, you wrote:
>Anita, how old is your son now?

> Karen
>

He just turned 11.

I, too, spent a lot of time being with him at events.

I remember the first time he went off by himself for over an hour. It was
with a relatively new unschooling group we had finally found. We'd met
with them several times and there were kids his age-6. They were playing
by the creek in the large backyard of someone's house. I hadn't seen him
for over an hour and I was a bit concerned and surprised and delighted. I
checked on him, but things were o.k.

Anita

Oxford School District
"There are many will claim to tell you what is due from you, but only one
who can shear through the many, and reach the truth. And that is you, by
what light falls for you to show the way." Brother Cadfael in "The Devil's
Novice" by Ellis Peters.

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] from unschool grad -shyness
messages.msgSnippet: Anita, how old is your son now? Karen
messages.messageBody:
Anita, how old is your son now?
Karen
